description:
节目简介：SherryAN侃英国是一个： 文艺清新（越说越污）、内涵深邃（深井冰晚期）、根正苗红（三观跑偏）同时又能教会大家很多英语文化小知识（绝对不是堆砌百科）的欢脱freetalk！

说起英国的乐坛，你想到了谁？老牌经典披头士？皇后？还是新晋天团酷玩or国民鲜肉小破团？这次就让我们聊一聊英国的国民偶像吧！本期真·听歌·福利~

THE BEATLES 1960-1970

为啥叫Beatles?

John loved 'Buddy Holly and the Crickets', so they toyed with insect names. It was John who came up with 'Beetles'. He changed it to 'Beatles' because he said if you turned it round it was 'les beat', which sounded French and cool.

披头士是史上最伟大、最有影响力的摇滚乐队。这支利物浦组建的英国摇滚乐队。根植于民歌爵士乐skiffle music和50年代摇滚（Rock and roll），披头士探索了各种音乐类型，从流行pop谣曲Ballad到迷幻摇滚Psychedelic rock，经常创新地运用经典元素。

获得荣誉有：美国史上销售量最高、英国排行榜上冠军专辑最多、英国单曲销量第一、史上最成功音乐人Hot 100 Top1、10座格莱美奖，1座奥斯卡、15座艾弗·诺韦洛奖。

One Direction

代表作：《What Makes You Beautiful》

为啥叫1D？

Harry came up with the band name because he thought the band had to go in "one direction" to win it all. Well, they didn't win the X Factor UK, but they did win the world!

英国、爱尔兰男子音乐组合。2010年7月23日于歌唱比赛“X音素”（The X Factor）上组成出道。赞恩·马利克退出后是4个人。

迷妹评价：

One Direction are my inspirations and they make me feel like I matter to the world, listening to their song also cheers me up when I'm having a bad day!

THE ROLLING STONES1962-now

为啥叫滚石？

代表作：Miss You

Little did the Rolling Stones know how apt their name – inspired by the title of a Muddy Waters song, “Rollin' Stone” – would turn out to be. Formed in 1962, they hold the record for longevity as a rock and roll band.

1962年4月在伦敦成立的英国摇滚乐队。乐队成立开始时期他们演奏自己改编的蓝调blues、节奏蓝调Rhythm and Blues(R&B)、乡村音乐Country music和摇滚乐。，滚石也始终没有停止从其它音乐形式获得新的灵感。在他们的音乐中他们吸收了雷鬼音乐Reggae、庞克摇滚Punk Rock和舞曲Dance music的成分。

The Rolling Stones are the longest surviving British band and have been recording music for over 51 years.

Coldplay

代表作：viva la vida、Fix You治愈神作

为啥叫酷玩？

The band was originally called Starfish, while a friend's group was called Coldplay. When the other band no longer wanted their name, Starfish asked if they could use it instead. The original Coldplay had taken the name from a book of collected poems.

97年成立于英国伦敦的另类摇滚alternative rock乐队。早期作品常被与之声司令、U2等相提并论。八个全英音乐奖、七个格莱美奖、五个MTV音乐录影带奖。并积极投身于社会与政治组织活动。

粉丝评价：

Great Music! Can't stop listening to it. And not gay at all.

Queen 1996-now

代表作：We Are the Champions、we will rock you

为啥叫皇后？

Queen. Originally called Smile, singer Freddie Mercury came up with the new name for the band, later saying: "Years ago I thought up the name 'Queen'… It's just a name, but it's very regal obviously, and it sounds splendid…It's a strong name, very universal and immediate.

英国摇滚乐乐队，成立于1971年伦敦，主唱和贝斯手逝世，现只剩下2人。

Oasis 1991-2008

代表作：Don't Look Back in Anger、wonderwall

Liam suggested that the band name be changed to Oasis. This change was inspired by an Inspiral Carpets tour poster that hung in the Gallagher brothers' bedroom. One of the venues the poster listed was the Oasis Leisure Centre in Swindon, Wiltshire.

1991年成立于曼彻斯特的英国摇滚乐团

8次英国冠军单曲、7张英国冠军专辑、15座NME音乐奖、9座Q音乐奖、4座MTV欧洲音乐大奖、6座全英音乐奖（包括2007年的杰出贡献奖）BBC之声听众票选三十年最佳英国专辑、三度格莱美提名。已解散

因为时间有限，乐队太多开始串烧：

Radiohead-Creep

Muse-unintended

U2- With Or Without You

Pink Floyd- Wish You Were Here

Take that- Patience

独立音乐Independent Music

Independent music (often shortened to indie music or indie) is music produced independently from major commercial record labels or their subsidiaries, a process that may include an autonomous, do-it-yourself approach to recording and publishing.

也被音译为硬地音乐，是指有别于主流商业唱片厂牌所制作的音乐。制作过程，从录音到出版都由音乐家独力完成。Indie这个词有时还指代一种流派，比如独立摇滚、独立流行。其实大多数独立音乐家是不能用某一种特定的音乐风格来界定的，他们创作的音乐也可以归入不同流派。

代表乐队：Oasis, Arctic Monkeys, Radiohead, 新兴的Black Honey, Flyte, Superfood 等

摇滚Rock and Roll

Rock and roll is a genre of popular music that originated and evolved in the United States during the late 1940s and early 1950s, from a combination of African-American genres such as blues, boogie-woogie, jump blues, jazz, and gospel music, together with Western swing and country music.

摇滚起源于美国，在上世纪40-50年代，结合了非裔美国人的音乐流派，比如布鲁斯、爵士等等，和西方的节奏强劲的音乐和乡村音乐。在1960-70年代有一股摇滚的热潮。

我们说得英国摇滚British Rock则是美国的摇滚传到英国之后发展起来的，虽然广泛认为影响力不如美国摇滚，但对于英国年青流行音乐文化的形成起到很重要作用，也是后来1960年代中期的英伦文化入侵的重要一部分。

代表：Beatles

民谣Ballad

A ballad /ˈbæləd/ is a form of verse, often a narrative set to music. It is a song that tells a story, and it can be dramatic, funny, or romantic.

民谣是一种流行的、被赋予民族色彩的歌曲，配上流行音乐，讲故事的民歌。英国民谣主要是分为英格兰民谣和苏格兰民谣。

代表：Top 20 Best Pop Ballads（YouTube）包括

Impossible, James Arthur

Between the Raindrops, Lifehouse featuring. Natasha Bedingfield

More Than This, One Direction

Stay, Rihanna featuring. Mikky Ekko

Someone Like You, Adele

Patience, Take That

Set Fire To The Rain, Adele

You’re Beautiful, James Blunt

流行音乐Pop Music

Identifying factors of pop music include generally short to medium-length songs written in a basic format (often the verse-chorus structure) as well as the common employment of repeated choruses, melodic tunes, and hooks.

有“大众音乐”之称，歌曲长度属于中短型，结构一般来说是比较基础的主歌+副歌的形式，迎合大众口味，广泛传唱的歌曲。会借鉴其他流派的一些元素，比如摇滚、乡村、拉丁、舞曲等等的元素。

例子太多，不用举了~

description:
大学里，我们会遇到很多场合，但往往不知道应该用英语准确表达自己的意思，下面为大家介绍2个最常用的场景对话——教学和看电影。

教学：

a:hi! how are you today?

b:i m fine! thank you. how are you?

a:fine thank you!right! i think we should give the student more work to do so they can remember what they did obviously they can get a better Results!

b:but i think you are wrong! becuase every one dont like to do lots works you have to catch the main point and let the student remember it so they can do any questions in that type!

a:i think you are right! thank you ! you give me a better idea!

b:no problem! you ca come and find me at any time. i'm mor than welcome!

 

看电影

a:hi! would you like to go to cinema with me? don't you think it cool watching film in the cinema than at home?

b:no i dont think so! if you go to cinema right you have to spend money to watch a film. i know it looks good but you still can found it in the internet. the film might be quicker on the internet than the cinema so why you have to spend that money on this boring thing? dont you think so?

a: but still it give you different feel if you are at the cinema!

b:Well,you can turn the light off when you watch a film at home and buy some popcorn,cola with it! same!

a:ok then! i'll see at home! see you later!

b:see you!
